subject: get NVMe values via raw smbus
commitMessage:
get NVMe values via raw smbus

with get the nvme sensor data values by mctp protocol, want to
get temperature data via raw smbus. so set the smbus functions
to get. separate NVMeContext related part as a NVMeMCTPContext
and add NVMeSMBusContext with busfd

Tested:

Change-Id: Iddb95455840e139c4187699cc278fe6d77ae6651
Signed-off-by: Jet Li <Jet.Li@ibm.com>

If we use of libi2c from the i2c-tools package we can remove this.
Done
I think we should consistently pick either underscores or camel-case.
Done
We should provide this in an nvme-smbus.hpp or something.
These structs seem like they would be common with the MCTP backend?
yes, so maybe should move these and using MCTP existing structs?
Yep, if we can do that we should.
Is there a reason not to do this work in the constructor?
Please remove this whitespace change from the patch.
Done
Is this necessary? Why?
for using gMutex.lock/unlock. as we discussed there's no need so remove it.
Why 30?
I set an default value but maybe we can set dynamic or something else?
You use `#define` here but `static constexpr`, the latter seems more C++-y
Done
Remove this from the patch.
Done

Can we keep consistency and use "nvmeSMBus" as the namespace? The code above already uses "nvmeMCTP".

Separately, it seems we're putting a completely different backend into the same source file. That makes it harder to read and review - can we separate them out? Do we need access to specific symbols only available in this file?
Done

We discussed that this wasn't necessary previously, and I still don't think it is. There's no need to keep an array of FDs, each FD can just be private to each instance. There's no need to lock around access to the master, that's the kernel's job (and you'd race against any other userspace applications if it didn't). We will need multiple instances of the class to represent each drive that we talk to though.
done. remove it
I don't think you need this as you've already enclosed the code in `namespace phosphor { namespace smbus {`. Same for the rest of the method declarations.
Done
Inconsistent indentation (tab vs spaces)
Done
Inconsistent indentation (tab vs spaces)
Done
If we're always closing the device it makes even less sense to keep an array of file descriptors :)
yes, so it needs to be removed that keep files?
What happens to success?
missing next action while success. adding it.
What was this for? It doesn't seem to be used at all.
Done
I don't think this should be provided by smbus.hpp. Further, we should try to keep with the existing naming schemes - we have nvmeMCTP::init(), shouldn't we be calling this nvmeSMBus::init()?
yes, sure. and also modify namespace in NVMeSensor.cpp
Include 'Tested' field.
Done. but need to finish progress then fill in these area.
nit:nvmePresent is more appropriate
yes, but does not need this struct then remove it.

This line should go to hpp file right?
Also what is 30 here?
yes, with this define should put hpp file and with structure change do not need this and remove.

it's default sensor failure but also do not need this.
